pageContext.description: Hilt mark shows - a silvery purple stain and in patches on the patina edges.
pageContext.patina: Bright brown, dull golden bronze shows.
pageContext.collection: N. Staffs. F. C. Museum, Hanley (1927),Rev. J. S. Caddick-Adams, donor,Brampton Lodge,Newcastle underLyme, Staffs.,acquired Sept. 1924
pageContext.site: England,Staffordshire,Audley,Bignall Hill Farm,Farmer -Saml. Hickson,"Found of the top of a hill a mile N. of Chesterton,Staffs." (Rev. J.S. C. A.),About 1921
pageContext.remarks: "The farmer was ploughing and struck a hollow and put his hand in and found this among small bones he judged to be human. He does not seem to have investigated much and ploughed over the place." Rev. J.S.C.A., 10.10.24
